jjwuttfmi ^Baptist College
M. JL Militants, flres&cnt
Palnut Jli&ge, ^xksxmaa
OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT
2-16-56
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
11 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Gentlemen:-
We are planning to build an educational FM radio
station here to serve our own needs in adult edu¬
cation and college work and also the needs of the
public schools of the area. We would appreciate your
counsel on the matter.
We have bought a good used 250 watt GE trans¬
mitter and the monitors. We have on hand the turn¬
tables and pick-up arms. We only need the antenna and
console to complete the technical equipment. We would
appreciate your suggestion of the name of a consult¬
ing engineer who would help us with the filing with
FCC at a reasonable fee.
Please give us the full data on your services
and the costs of same. Also give us the listings of
other sources of programming materials.
We have had rather broad experience in commercial
radio and teach announcing and management here. This
is the first time that we have attempted educational
radio.
HEW/s
